heading.title: Proposed Agreement to be made between [NAMES OF PARTIES].

preamble.para: We refer to the agreement (Agreement) to be entered into today between [FULL NAME OF SELLER] (Seller) and [FULL NAME OF BUYER] (Buyer) for the sale and purchase of the entire issued share capital of [[TARGET] Limited OR the assets and undertaking of the business of [BUSINESS]].

This letter is the Disclosure Letter referred to in the Agreement and constitutes formal disclosure to the Buyer for the purposes of the Agreement of the facts and circumstances which are or may be inconsistent with the representations, warranties and undertakings referred to in clause [NUMBER] and contained in Schedule [NUMBER] of the Agreement (Warranties) or which otherwise give or may give rise to a claim under the Agreement by the Buyer [in respect of the Warranties]. Such facts and circumstances will be deemed to qualify the Warranties accordingly.

[This Disclosure Letter is written on behalf of the Seller. The matters and information disclosed or referred to in this letter have been supplied to us by or on behalf of the Seller and, accordingly, this firm accepts no responsibility or liability whatsoever and howsoever arising from the accuracy, completeness or otherwise of all or any part of such matters and information.]

Terms defined in the Agreement shall have the same meaning in this letter. References in this letter to paragraph headings and numbers shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be to those headings and numbered paragraphs in Schedule [NUMBER] of the Agreement. Such headings and numbering are for convenience only and shall not alter the construction of this letter nor in any way limit the effect of any of the disclosures, all of which are made against the Warranties as a whole. A disclosure or qualification made by reference to any particular paragraph shall be deemed to be made also in respect of any other paragraph to which the disclosure or qualification may be applicable.

The disclosure of any matter or document shall not imply any representation, warranty or undertaking not expressly given in the Agreement nor shall such disclosure be taken as extending the scope of any of the Warranties.

clause.para: By way of general disclosure, the following matters are disclosed or deemed disclosed to the Buyer:
The contents of the Agreement and all transactions referred to therein.
[The contents of the Memorandum and Articles of Association of each member of the [TARGET COMPANY GROUP] (Group) and the documents annexed thereto, copies of which have been provided to the Buyer.]
All matters which would be revealed by an online search of the file of each member of the Group at the Companies Registry at the date hereof.
[The contents of the minute books and other statutory books of each member of the Group, all of which have been made available to the Buyer.]

All matters which would be shown by searches at HM Land Registry and HM Land Charges Registry at the date of this letter and all matters which would be shown by searches at the local authorities and all other public registers relevant to the [PropertiesORreal properties owned or occupied by members of the Group] carried out at the date of this letter by the Buyer [as a buyer of such Properties OR as if it were a buyer of such Properties].
All matters contained in the deeds to the Properties, which have been made available to the Buyer.
All matters which would be apparent from an inspection of the Properties at the date of this letter.

All matters contained or referred to in the documents in the bundle of documents annexed to this letter, two copies of which have been initialled by the parties thereto for the purposes of identification.

Any matters referred to in correspondence between the Seller or its advisers and the Buyer or its advisers together with all enclosures attached thereto and all matters referred to in such enclosures.

All matters shown in the audited reports and accounts of [the Seller] [each member of the Group] for the financial periods [DATE] to [DATE] [and any matters shown in the management accounts of [the Company] [the Seller] for the periods [DATE] to [DATE]].

[All matters disclosed to [the accountants of the Buyer [and/or [OTHERS]] or which ought reasonably to have been revealed in the course of the investigation [of the Seller OR of the Group] by [such accountants [and/or [OTHERS]] and all matters disclosed in the report produced by [such accountants [and/or [OTHERS]] dated [DATE] [on the Business OR on the business and affairs of the Group OR All matters disclosed in the replies to the pre-contract enquiries raised by the Buyer's solicitors dated [DATE] and the replies to those enquiries dated [DATE]].

All matters which would be revealed by a search of the registers and documents maintained by the Office of Fair Trading, the Consumer Credit Registry, the Trademarks Registry or the Patent Office in respect of each member of the Group as at the date of this letter.
[SPECIFY OTHER DOCUMENTS OR INFORMATION TO BE DEEMED DISCLOSED.]

All matters of which the Buyer ought reasonably (without having made specific enquiry) to be aware as affecting a business similar to the [business carried on by the Company ORthe Business] and all matters which are a matter of public record or within the public domain.

Where brief particulars only of a matter are set out or referred to in this letter, or a document is referred to but not attached, or a reference is made to a particular part only of such document, full particulars of the matter and the full contents of the document are deemed to be disclosed and it is assumed that the Buyer does not require any further particulars.
The following specific disclosures are made in relation to the Warranties:
[SET OUT SPECIFIC DISCLOSURES.]
Please acknowledge receipt and acceptance of this Disclosure Letter by signing, dating and returning the enclosed copy of this letter.
[Seller or Seller's solicitors]
We hereby acknowledge receipt and accept the contents of this Disclosure Letter
